--- layout: default title: OHBM 2011 ---
This collection organizes a number of different posters and talks from NISOx and NISOx collaborators at the 2011 Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM) in Quebec City, June 10-14.

Talks

This section lists all available OHBM 2011 standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • From Univariate to Multivariate imaging Genetic Analyses
    Authors: Thomas Nichols, Maria Vounou, Giovanni Montana. Talk from the ''Imaging Genetics: Multivariate Analyses for Neural and Genetic Circuitry'' morning workshop. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484982.v1
  • Finding Activations: Power, Specificity, and Selection Bias
    Authors: Thomas Nichols, Jeanette Mumford. Talk from the Advanced fMRI course. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5485015.v1

Posters

This section lists all available posters submitted to OHBM 2011 by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Accurate and Computationally Efficient Analysis of Longitudinal fMRI data
    Authors: Bryan Guillaume, et al.
  • Reverse-Inference for Meta-Analysis: Predicting Study Type with a Fully Bayesian Spatial Model
    Authors: Jian Kang, et al.
  • Bayesian Gaussian Processes for Coordinate-based Metaanalysis of Neuroimaging Reports
    Authors: Reza Salimi-Khorshidi, et al.

Courses

This section lists all available OHBM 2011 courses created by or contributed towards by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Introduction to Imaging Genetics
  • How To Be a Skeptical Neuroimager - Functional Connectivity & Causal Modeling
